meanings.definition: Past tense of mudsling: to engage in malicious gossip or slander.
meanings.sent1: She mudslung hurtful words about her friend.
meanings.sent2: Yesterday, he mudslung rumors about his coworker.
meanings.sent3: The group chat was filled with mudslung comments that caused unnecessary drama.
meanings.sent4: The politician mudslung accusations at his opponent during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The online forum was a place where users often mudslung without consequences.

meanings.definition: Participial adjective: characterized by malicious gossip or slander.
meanings.sent1: The mudslung comments spread quickly through the small town.
meanings.sent2: Her reputation was tarnished by the mudslung stories circulating about her.
meanings.sent3: The party turned awkward when mudslung remarks were made about the host.
meanings.sent4: The mudslung campaign ads created a negative atmosphere during the election.
meanings.sent5: The office environment became toxic due to the mudslung behavior of certain employees.
